# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/_palettes.py
@source-hash: 71d7afd4940a6742
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:00:47Z

## Primary Purpose
Predefined color palettes module for the Rich library's terminal color system. Contains RGB color definitions for different terminal environments and standards.

## Key Components

### WINDOWS_PALETTE (L5-24)
16-color palette based on Windows 10 ANSI escape code colors. Contains RGB tuples for the standard 16 colors used in Windows terminal environments, sourced from Wikipedia's ANSI escape code documentation.

### STANDARD_PALETTE (L27-46) 
16-color palette representing standard ANSI colors including bright variants. Provides the classic terminal color scheme with RGB values for basic colors (0-7) and their bright counterparts (8-15).

### EIGHT_BIT_PALETTE (L50-309)
Comprehensive 256-color palette for 8-bit terminal color support. Contains:
- First 16 colors (L52-67): Standard ANSI colors
- Colors 16-231 (L68-283): 6x6x6 RGB color cube with systematic RGB value progression
- Colors 232-255 (L284-308): 24-level grayscale ramp from dark to light

## Dependencies
- `.palette.Palette` (L1): Core Palette class for color management

## Architecture Notes
- All palettes stored as lists of RGB tuples (red, green, blue) with 0-255 values
- Palettes are module-level constants for efficient reuse
- EIGHT_BIT_PALETTE follows xterm-256color standard structure
- Color ordering follows ANSI/VT100 terminal specifications

## Usage Context
These palettes enable Rich library to map color names/indices to RGB values for different terminal capabilities and operating systems, supporting graceful degradation from true-color to 8-bit to 4-bit color modes.
